How to Install ladish on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • ladish

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install ladish on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing ladish on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall ladish in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install ladish, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install ladish Using apt

To install ladish in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install ladish using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install ladish

The installation of ladish might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install ladish Using apt-get

To install ladish using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install ladish.

sudo apt-get -y install ladish

Install ladish Using Synaptic

To install ladish using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install ladish on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for ladish. This will display the ladish package in the package window, now to install ladish, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the ladish package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of ladish.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install ladish Using aptitude

To install ladish on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of ladish.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install ladish using the command aptitude install ladish.

sudo aptitude -y install ladish

How to Upgrade ladish on debian

If you want to upgrade the ladish package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade ladish using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade ladish to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade ladish.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade ladish sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade ladish

Upgrade ladish using Aptitude

To upgrade ladish using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade ladish.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade ladish

Upgrade ladish using Synaptic

To upgrade ladish using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for ladish, now right-click ladish, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade ladish just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall ladish on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall ladish from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just ladish, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove ladish

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of ladish

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of ladish you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge ladish

Remove ladish using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall ladish using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for ladish, right-click the ladish package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall ladish click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install ladish on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade ladish using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.
